title: R42621
content: Some in the 112th Congress wanted to cut international affairs spending, including foreign aid programs, to reduce the federal budget deficit. However, others believed a strong foreign affairs budget was crucial for national security and foreign policy interests. Congress delayed passing the FY2013 Department of State appropriations, eventually passing a continuing resolution until March 27, 2013. The Budget Control Act of 2011 led to delays in passing appropriations bills, including State-Foreign Operations, until after the new fiscal year. A continuing resolution was passed to fund the government until March 27, 2013. Legislation (H.R. 933) was passed to fund federal programs for the remainder of FY2013, signed into law on March 26, 2013. The State-Foreign Operations appropriation supports international affairs programs and activities, including foreign assistance, State Department operations, and international broadcasting. The State-Foreign Operations appropriations bill funds international affairs programs, foreign assistance, State Department operations, and international broadcasting. It includes Function 150 programs but not all international affairs programs. Some programs funded through other appropriations bills are also considered international affairs. A chart illustrating the bill's organizational structure is provided in the report. Abbreviations of terms used are listed in the appendix.
